Material used.Description: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice were used for confocal imaging.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1-deficient neurons exhibited depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm), fragmented mitochondria, and elevated ROS levels compared to wild-type controls.
E417G mutant PINK1 failed to restore ΔΨm, mitochondrial morphology, or ROS levels in overexpression experiments.
CΔ145 mutant PINK1 also failed to restore ΔΨm, mitochondrial morphology, or ROS levels in overexpression experiments.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector overexpression was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm) ≥ 80% of wild-type levels, intact mitochondrial morphology, and ROS levels ≤ 50% of mutant levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm) < 60% of wild-type levels, fragmented mitochondrial morphology, and ROS levels > 150% of mutant levels.
